oai_dc:dc.dc:title: 1960-11-07 Correspondence
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: law; libraries; civil rights; desegregation; Russell, Edward P.; 1960s;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A letter sent from Edward P. Russell to Wassell Randolph, Walter Chandler, William F. Murrah, and C. Lamar Wallis: "The Clerk of the Court has written as follows: 'It having come to the attention of Judge Miller that there is a dispute as to the terms of the order to be entered closing the above styled case, you are hereby notified that the hearing on the terms of the order is set at 2:00 p.m., Wednesday, November 9, 1960.' -- Will you please be present, -- Yours very truly, -- Edward P. Russell"
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Russell, Edward P.
